Skills:
Minimum of 10 years’ experience as an Instrumentation Commissioning Engineer with a broad knowledge of commissioning planning and execution experience, for Utilities areas or LNG liquefaction facilities or large Oil & Gas facility.
Experienced pre-commissioning/commissioning large Utilities packages such as Boilers, Steam Turbines, GTG’s, HSRG’s and field instrumentation such as Smart Transmitters (HART), Smart Junction Boxes, Instrument Asset Management Systems, Fiscal Metering Systems, Tank Gauging, Specialty Analyzers / sampling systems, Gas Chromatographs, Control & On / Off Valves, ESDV, Blowdown Valves and accessories, MOV’s, Fire & Gas devices, BMS / Flare Panels and specialty instruments associated with large compressors.
Good understanding of International (ISA/IEC) Standards and best practices in the areas of Instrumentation installations.
Demonstrated experience of using Instrument calibration tools and instrument configuration set-ups.
Expertise in systemization, development of instrumentation pre-comm/comm procedures.
Strong leadership skills, experience leading contractor teams.
Experience with Smart Completions database use and set-up desirable.
Bachelor’s degree in engineering or equivalent.
